bio: Etienne Mason, known professionally as MAYSUN, is a composer and sound artist whose work transforms physical spaces into immersive sound environments.

Centered around modular systems, DIY electronics, and cyclical processing, MAYSUN develops adaptable sound structures that interact with and reshape the contexts they inhabit. Blurring the lines between site-responsive installations and performance, his practice creates moments where sound, the room, and the listener become inseparable.

MAYSUN has served on the Board of Directors of the Canadian Electroacoustic Community (CEC) since 2023. He completed the 2024 ITP/IMA Fellowship at New York University, participated in the New Amsterdam Composers Lab, and is currently a mentor at NEW INC. He also was awarded a 2025-2026 microgrant from Rhizome.
In addition to his artistic practice, MAYSUN maintains a digital archive called Forever In Sound, documenting his complete creative evolution.
statement: MAYSUN explores how spatial audio, environmental sound, technology, and emotional resonance combine to create immersive experiences.

Working with modular systems, custom electronics, and site-responsive installations, he develops adaptable sound environments that interact with and reshape the spaces they inhabit. His approach is grounded in self-taught methods emphasizing direct material engagement.
Through ongoing documentation and experimentation, his work resists traditional music industry formats, prioritizing experience and process over fixed products.
His current focus involves developing portable & scalable spatial sound systems that make immersive audio accessible in any space.
